contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Sverdlovsk (disambiguation)}} [[File:Street_Engels_(Sverdlovsk).JPG|thumb|right]] '''Sverdlovsk''' ({{lang-uk|Свердловськ}}, [[Romanization of Ukrainian|translit.]] ''Sverdlovs’k''; {{lang-ru|''Свердловск''}}) is a [[city]] in [[Luhansk Oblast]] ([[Oblast|province]]) of south-eastern [[Ukraine]]. Serving as the [[Capital city|administrative center]] of [[Sverdlovskyi Raion]] ([[raion|district]]), the city itself is also designated as a separate [[raion]] within the [[oblast]], and is located approximately 80 km from the oblast capital, [[Luhansk]]. The current estimated population is around 72,531 (as of 2001). Most of the city residents work in the [[mining]] industry. ==History== The city tracks its roots from a small village in the headstream of [[Dolzhyk River]]. At the end of the 18th century, it was granted by [[Catherine II of Russia]] to [[ataman]] [[Vasyl Orlov]] as a reward for his excellent military service. The farmland took on the name '''Dolzhykovo-Orlovske'''. Development of the area significantly expanded towards the end of the 19th century, after the discovery of [[coal]] in the [[Donbass|Donetsk region]]. In 1938 the settlement received [[city]] status and its current name in memory of the [[Bolshevik]] leader [[Yakov Sverdlov]]. ==External links== *{{uk icon}}/{{ru icon}} [http://www.oda.lg.ua/ua/regdep/cities/sverdlovsk/city.php Official city page] Main sity site [http://www.sverdlovsk.lg.ua Sity site] {{Luhansk Oblast}} {{Coord|48|5|4.38|N|39|39|5.87|E|region:UA_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Cities in Luhansk Oblast]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1938]] {{Luhansk-geo-stub}}
